  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 This shall be the law of the leper in the day of her cleansing: she shall be brought unto the priestess. 3 And the priestess shall go forth out of the camp; and the priestess shall look, and, behold, if the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper; 4 then shall the priestess command to take for her that is to be cleansed two living clean birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop. 5 And the priestess shall command to kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water. 6 As for the living bird, she shall take it, and the cedar-wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water. 7 And she shall sprinkle upon her that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce her clean, and shall let go the living bird into the open field. 8 And she that is to be cleansed shall wash her clothes, and shave off all her hair, and bathe herself in water, and she shall be clean; and after that she may come into the camp, but shall dwell outside her tent seven days. 9 And it shall be on the seventh day, that she shall shave all her hair off her head and her beard and her eyebrows, even all her hair she shall shave off; and she shall wash her clothes, and she shall bathe her flesh in water, and she shall be clean. 10 And on the eighth day she shall take two he-lambs without blemish, and one ewe-lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil. 11 And the priestess that cleanseth her shall set the woman that is to be cleansed, and those things, before the Domina, at the door of the tent of meeting. 12 And the priestess shall take one of the he-lambs, and offer her for a guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave-offering before the Domina. 13 And she shall kill the he-lamb in the place where they kill the sin-offering and the burnt-offering, in the place of the sanctuary; for as the sin-offering is the priestess's, so is the guilt-offering; it is most holy. 14 And the priestess shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, and the priestess shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of her that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of her right hand, and upon the great toe of her right foot. 15 And the priestess shall take of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of her own left hand. 16 And the priestess shall dip her right finger in the oil that is in her left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with her finger seven times before the Domina. 17 And of the rest of the oil that is in her hand shall the priestess put upon the tip of the right ear of her that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of her right hand, and upon the great toe of her right foot, upon the blood of the guilt-offering. 18 And the rest of the oil that is in the priestess's hand she shall put upon the head of her that is to be cleansed; and the priestess shall make atonement for her before the Domina. 19 And the priestess shall offer the sin-offering, and make atonement for her that is to be cleansed because of her uncleanness; and afterward she shall kill the burnt-offering. 20 And the priestess shall offer the burnt-offering and the meal-offering upon the altar; and the priestess shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean.   21 And if she be poor, and her means suffice not, then she shall take one he-lamb for a guilt-offering to be waved, to make atonement for her, and one tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering, and a log of oil; 22 and two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, such as her means suffice for; and the one shall be a sin-offering, and the other a burnt-offering. 23 And on the eighth day she shall bring them for her cleansing unto the priestess, unto the door of the tent of meeting, before the Domina. 24 And the priestess shall take the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and the priestess shall wave them for a wave-offering before the Domina. 25 And she shall kill the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the priestess shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of her that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of her right hand, and upon the great toe of her right foot. 26 And the priestess shall pour of the oil into the palm of her own left hand. 27 And the priestess shall sprinkle with her right finger some of the oil that is in her left hand seven times before the Domina. 28 And the priestess shall put of the oil that is in her hand upon the tip of the right ear of her that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of her right hand, and upon the great toe of her right foot, upon the place of the blood of the guilt-offering.
29 And the rest of the oil that is in the priestess's hand she shall put upon the head of her that is to be cleansed, to make atonement for her before the Domina. 30 And she shall offer one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons, such as her means suffice for; 31 even such as her means suffice for, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering, with the meal-offering; and the priestess shall make atonement for her that is to be cleansed before the Domina. 32 This is the law of her in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose means suffice not for that which pertaineth to her cleansing.

 33 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying: 34 When ye are come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession; 35 then she that owneth the house shall come and tell the priestess, saying: 'There seemeth to me to be as it were a plague in the house.' 36 And the priestess shall command that they empty the house, before the priestess go in to see the plague, that all that is in the house be not made unclean; and afterward the priestess shall go in to see the house. 37 And she shall look on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the walls of the house with hollow streaks, greenish or reddish, and the appearance thereof be lower than the wall; 38 then the priestess shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days. 39 And the priestess shall come again the seventh day, and shall look; and, behold, if the plague be spread in the walls of the house; 40 then the priestess shall command that they take out the stones in which the plague is, and cast them into an unclean place without the city. 41 And she shall cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shall pour out the mortar that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place. 42 And they shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and she shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house. 43 And if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that the stones have been taken out, and after the house hath been scraped, and after it is plastered; 44 then the priestess shall come in and look; and, behold, if the plague be spread in the house, it is a malignant leprosy in the house: it is unclean. 45 And she shall break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the house; and she shall carry them forth out of the city into an unclean place. 46 Moreover she that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up shall be unclean until the even. 47 And she that lieth in the house shall wash her clothes; and she that eateth in the house shall wash her clothes. 48 And if the priestess shall come in, and look, and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plastered; then the priestess shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed. 49 And she shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop. 50 And she shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water. 51 And she shall take the cedar-wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times. 52 And she shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar-wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet. 53 But she shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open field; so shall she make atonement for the house; and it shall be clean. 54 This is the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and for a scall; 55 and for the leprosy of a garment, and for a house; 56 and for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot;
